newsitem.title: SWITZERLAND: Mercedes-Benz says sales up in 1997.
newsitem.headline: Mercedes-Benz says sales up in 1997.

text.p: A top executive at Mercedes-Benz AG, a unit of Daimler-Benz AG, said on Monday that unit sales at the German carmaker were up five percent in the first two months of 1997 and he expected full-year sales to be clearly above 1996 levels.
"The chances are good that we can clearly increase our sales this year," Mercedes manager and board member Juergen Hubbert told a company dinner at the Geneva car show.
He also said Mercedes wanted to sell nearly one million cars a year by the turn of the century, but would not become a mass producer and instead keep its reputation as a quality carmaker.
"We have maintained the successful trend of 1996," Hubbert said. Mercedes in 1996 increased sales by 10 percent to 645,000.
